intro: Hieracium atratiforme, commonly known as the dark-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are dark green and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. Hieracium atratiforme is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its resilience to environmental stress.
